description: Extract relative transformations, pass 1 of 2 for stabilization (see vidstabtransform for pass 2).
name: vidstabdetect

options.description: Set the path to the file used to write the transforms information. Default value is transforms.trf.
options.name: result

options.description: Set how shaky the video is and how quick the camera is. It accepts an integer in the range 1-10, a value of 1 means little shakiness, a value of 10 means strong shakiness. Default value is 5.
options.name: shakiness

options.description: Set the accuracy of the detection process. It must be a value in the range 1-15. A value of 1 means low accuracy, a value of 15 means high accuracy. Default value is 15.
options.name: accuracy

options.description: Set stepsize of the search process. The region around minimum is scanned with 1 pixel resolution. Default value is 6.
options.name: stepsize

options.description: Set minimum contrast. Below this value a local measurement field is discarded. Must be a floating point value in the range 0-1. Default value is 0.3.
options.name: mincontrast

options.description: Show fields and transforms in the resulting frames. It accepts an integer in the range 0-2. Default value is 0, which disables any visualization.
options.name: show

options.description:
Set reference frame number for tripod mode.

If enabled, the motion of the frames is compared to a reference frame in the filtered stream, identified by the specified number. The idea is to compensate all movements in a more-or-less static scene and keep the camera view absolutely still.

If set to 0, it is disabled. The frames are counted starting from 1.
options.name: tripod
